alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN LEWIS, SOUTHEASTERN ADAMS AND SOUTHWESTERN SCIOTO COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 615 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Camp Dix, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Vanceburg, Head of Grassy, Camp Dix, Blue Creek, Otway, Lombardsville, Sandy Springs, Buena Vista in Scioto County, Saint Paul, Firebrick, West Portsmouth, Wamsley, Tannery, Turkey Creek Lake, Friendship, Mcdermott, Garrison and Rexton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
